definition: canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: The poor pauper paused on purpose to pawn a porpoise.
sentences.chinese: 貧窮的乞丐有意停下來典當一隻海豚。

sentences.english: Three years ago I pawned my last television.
sentences.chinese: 三年前，我典當我的最後一次電視。

sentences.english: They redeemed the necklace they had pawned.
sentences.chinese: 他們贖回了典當的項鍊。

sentences.english: There are lots of pawns soul's body in the pawnshop, they do all housework.
sentences.chinese: 當鋪中有許多典當了靈魂的軀殼，他們做任何的家務。

sentences.english: He had no way to redeem his furniture out of pawn.
sentences.chinese: 他無法贖回典當的傢俱。

sentences.english: Koreas thin film to pawn shops, hurriedly Xie Re snow to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 韓疏影趕到典當行，慌忙把謝若雪送到了醫院。

sentences.english: If we do not reform the development of pawnbroking will be limited.
sentences.chinese: 不進行改革，就會制約典當業的發展。

sentences.english: I have redeemed my pawned watch.
sentences.chinese: 我已經贖回了典當的手錶。

sentences.english: Chapter Three contains the development of Fujian pawn shops and the status quo;
sentences.chinese: 第三章分析福建典當業發展現狀與發展態勢。

sentences.english: The unemployed reporter pawned his typewriter to pay the rent.
sentences.chinese: 失了業的記者典當了打字機用以交租。

sentences.english: The old pawn shop is located in the FuQiang Street.
sentences.chinese: 清代年間此街有當鋪，故富強街舊稱典當街。

sentences.english: He can't even remember how many times he visited a pawnshop.
sentences.chinese: 如今，他已記不清自己光顧過多少次典當行了。

sentences.english: The pawnbroking is an old and new developing trade .
sentences.chinese: 典當業是一個既古老而又新興的行業。

sentences.english: Equity swap between shareholders of the listed company and shareholders of Xingda Pawn.
sentences.chinese: 上市公司股東與興達典當股東進行股權置換。

sentences.english: Theystarted pawning jewelry, even their wedding rings.
sentences.chinese: 他們開始典當珠寶，甚至他們的結婚戒指。

sentences.english: The pawn business has a long history in China.
sentences.chinese: 典當業在我國源遠流長。

definition: to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
variant of 巨額|巨额[ju4 e2]
to disappear without trace/to vanish all of a sudden/to spread fast/to spread like wildfire
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to lend money (for interest)/to give credit
